text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Good girls go to heaven, bad girls go everywhere.
author: Mae West

text: There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out.
author: Mae West

text: I never loved another person the way I loved myself.
author: Mae West

text: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.
author: Mae West

text: Men are easy to get but hard to keep.
author: Mae West

text: All discarded lovers should be given a second chance, but with somebody else.
author: Mae West

text: Save a boyfriend for a rainy day and another, in case it doesn't rain.
author: Mae West

text: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire, women will like him.
author: Mae West

text: I believe that it's better to be looked over than it is to be overlooked.
author: Mae West

text: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
author: Mae West

text: You are never too old to look younger.
author: Mae West

text: Save a boyfriend for a rainy day - and another, in case it doesn't rain.
author: Mae West

text: Right now I think censorship is necessary; the things they're doing and saying in films right now just shouldn't be allowed. There's no dignity anymore and I think that's very important.
author: Mae West

text: I'm single because I was born that way.
author: Mae West

text: When women go wrong, men go right after them.
author: Mae West

text: Well, it's not the men in your life that counts, it's the life in your men.
author: Mae West

text: Between two evils I always pick the one I never tried before.
author: Mae West

text: Sex is emotion in motion.
author: Mae West

text: If I asked for a cup of coffee, someone would search for the double meaning.
author: Mae West

text: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.
author: Mae West

text: They say love is blind...and marriage is an institution. Well, I'm not ready for an institution for the blind just yet.
author: Mae West

text: He who hesitates is last.
author: Mae West

text: Too many girls follow the line of least resistance, but a good line is hard to resist.
author: Mae West

text: There are no good girls gone wrong—just bad girls found out.
author: Mae West

text: I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.
author: Mae West

text: When Im good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
author: Mae West

text: Getting married is like trading in the adoration of many for the sarcasm of one.
author: Mae West

text: I never worry about diets. The only carrots that interest me are the number you get in a diamond.
author: Mae West

text: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
author: Mae West

text: Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often.
author: Mae West

text: You are never too old to become younger!
author: Mae West

text: Dates in Calendar are closer than they appear! Time is what keeps everything from happening at once. Keep a diary, and someday it'll keep you.
author: Mae West

text: You're never too old to become younger.
author: Mae West

text: Keep a diary, and someday it'll keep you.
author: Mae West

text: Love is like a booger, you pick and pick at it. Then when you get it you wonder how to get rid of it.
author: Mae West

text: When I'm good, I'm very good. But when I'm bad I'm better.
author: Mae West

text: It's all right for a perfect stranger to kiss your hand as long as he's perfect.
author: Mae West

text: Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided.
author: Mae West

text: Personality is the glitter that sends your little gleam across the footlights and the orchestra pit into that big black space where the audience is.
author: Mae West

text: I saw what a mess a lot of people could make of their lives when they're smitten. Some of them go temporarily insane. They find a person who they think holds the key to their happiness-the only key to their happiness... My work has always been my greatest happiness.
author: Mae West

text: I'm no angel, but I've spread my wings a bit.
author: Mae West

text: Ladies who play with fire must remember that smoke gets in their eyes.
author: Mae West

text: Between two evils, I generally like to pick the one I never tried before.
author: Mae West

text: You know, it was a toss up whether I go in for diamonds or sing in the choir. The choir lost.
author: Mae West

text: Your real security is yourself. You know you can do it and they can't ever take that way from you.
author: Mae West

text: Women are as old as they feel - and men are old when they lose their feelings.
author: Mae West

text: He's the kind of man who picks his friends—to pieces.
author: Mae West

text: Don't let a man put anything over on you except an umbrella.
author: Mae West

text: A dame that knows the ropes isn’t likely to get tied up.
author: Mae West

text: Don’t marry a man to reform him—that’s what reform schools are for.
author: Mae West

text: Love conquers all things--expect poverty and toothache.
author: Mae West

text: He’s the kind of man a woman would have to marry to get rid of.
author: Mae West

text: I go for two kinds of men. The kind with muscles and the kind without.
author: Mae West

text: When it comes to finances, remember that there are no withholding taxes on the wages of sin.
author: Mae West

text: To err is human—but it feels divine.
author: Mae West
